intro: Fagara costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the humid lowland forests of Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces fruit that is typically a rough, greenish-yellow berry. Fagara costaricensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
